ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Improved Chinese fluency, listening comprehension, reading comprehension, and general communication skills.
I further developed my ability to read, speak, and understand Chinese.
Furthered my Chinese language skills
I furthered my skills in Mandarin Chinese, and learned new vocabulary and grammar structures. Additionally, I Now have greater insight into the cultural context behind the Chinese language.
Developed my Chinese speaking, reading, writing, and listening skills by a lot in a short time.
Oral, aural, reading, and writing Chinese. The course is taught almost exclusively in Chinese, and it was a turning point for me in my Chinese proficiency.
I learned more about Chinese, specifically improving my reading, speaking, listening, and writing skills.

I further developed my Chinese writing, listening, and speaking skills. We covered vocabulary relevant to a variety of real-world situations, including: relationships, traveling abroad, applying to a job, or going to a doctor:
I have increased my proficiency in speaking, reading, and writing.
Chinese language
I was able to gain more comfort while speaking Chinese.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: strengths: greatly improve fluency and communication skills

Strengths: Teacher, TAs, amount of learning
Weaknesses: NA

STRENGTHS: Organized, comprehensive, small class size, TA support, great Prof, manageable workload, allows for a lot of independent learning.

WEAKNESSES:  Hard to learn material with how fast paced it is.

Strengths: lot of practice and work to improve Chinese 
Weaknesses: class wasn't structured the best

Strengths: Extremely rapid pace. Class is taught exclusively in Chinese, and daily 30-minute tutorial sessions really hone in your conversational skills. For me, this class was a turning point in becoming confident enough to speak Chinese

Additionally, there were no exams for handwriting (just asynchronous practice) and all exams were asynchronous. This greatly helped in reducing the workload for the class.

Weaknesses: Rapid pace can lead to burnout at times. Voicethread assignments took longer than most other assignments, leading to Mondays and Wednesdays having significantly more homework than Tuesdays and Thursdays.

This course had a variety of assignments to improve my Chinese skills in many aspects, such as listening practices, online dictations, or speaking practices. Also, effort in the course was a signficant portion of the grade so tests alone did not solely determine the grade in this course. Overall I did not feel there were any major weaknesses in the course.

The course was well structured to facilitate student learning. Every chapter was followed by exercises in new vocabulary, reading, and listening comprehension. There were also regular essay assignments which allowed me to consolidate my knowledge of vocabulary and sentence structures. Feedback was also given in a timely manner.
I really enjoyed the overall structure of the class!
Friendly instructor, relatively interesting and lively classes. A lot of work but that's how you learn, I guess.
It was very work intensive which for me was both a strength and weakness. I was able to rapidly increase my ability in Chinese but also found myself a bit weighed down by the course.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely! L3 Chinese has been my favorite Chinese course to date. Compared to L2 and L1 this course found a good balance between developing fluency and learning vocabulary/grammar.
Definitely the best way to continue your language learning.

I would recommend this course if you have the time to dedicate yourself fully to it. It can be difficult if you also have a job/internship/other time commitment. It is still manageable, but the course moves very fast and deadlines are short. It can get a bit stressful. Otherwise, the course is well organized and you will learn a lot. There is a lot of support from teachers and TA's to ensure aid learning.
Yes
I would recommend this course to another student because it allowed me to further my Chinese skills as I continue to study the language and it allowed me to fully immerse myself in the language.
Absolutely! If you want to make substantial progress in Chinese and prepare for advanced study of the language, this course is a must.
yes, absolutely
Yes, if they wanted to work hard to learn Chinese.
Yes, it is a great course for improving your Chinese and the professor was very helpful and passionate about every student's achievements.
